010package imagingbook.common.filter.edgepreserving;
011
012import imagingbook.common.filter.generic.GenericFilterScalar;
013import imagingbook.common.image.PixelPack.PixelSlice;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * Scalar version of the Nagao-Matsuyama filter. This class implements a 5x5 Nagao-Matsuyama filter, as described in
018 * [1]. See Sec. 17.1 of [2] for additional details.
019 * </p>
020 * <p>
021 * [1] M. Nagao and T. Matsuyama. Edge preserving smoothing. Computer Graphics and Image Processing 9(4), 394â€“407
022 * (1979).
023 * <br>
024 * [2] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
025 * (2022).
026 * </p>
027 *
028 * @author WB
029 * @version 2021/01/02
030 */
031public class NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar extends GenericFilterScalar implements NagaoMatsuyamaF {
032
033        private final float varThreshold;
034        private float minVariance;
035        private float minMean;
036        
037        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar() {
038                this(new Parameters());
039        }
040        
041        public NagaoMatsuyamaFilterScalar(Parameters params) {
042                this.varThreshold = (float) params.varThreshold;
043        }
044        
045        // ------------------------------------------------------
046
047        @Override
048        protected float doPixel(PixelSlice plane, int u, int v) {
049                minVariance = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
050                evalSubregion(plane, Constants.R0, u, v);
051                minVariance = minVariance - varThreshold;
052                for (int[][] Rk : Constants.SubRegions) {
053                        evalSubregion(plane, Rk, u, v);
054                }
055                return minMean;
056        }
057        
058        void evalSubregion(PixelSlice source, int[][] R, int u, int v) {
059                float sum1 = 0; 
060                float sum2 = 0;
061                int n = 0;
062                for (int[] p : R) {
063                        float a = source.getVal(u+p[0], v+p[1]);
064                        sum1 = sum1 + a;
065                        sum2 = sum2 + a * a;
066                        n = n + 1;
067                }
068                float nr = n;
069                float var = (sum2 - sum1 * sum1 / nr) / nr;     // = sigma^2
070                if (var < minVariance) {
071                        minVariance = var;
072                        minMean = sum1 / nr; // mean of subregion with min. variance so far
073                }
074        }
075        
076}
